page.title: 10Farming
page.content:
Farmland in the area is slowly getting smaller and more and more acres are being used for housing, but the land available is used for dairy, sheep or arable farming and many acres are set aside for fruit and vegetable growing.
St. Leonards Farm in Nazeing covers an area of 250 acres and is a sheep and arable farm.
Also in Nazeing is Shottentens Farm which has 93 acres and is a dairy farm.
Perry Hill Farm is a mixed farm with 74 acres.
Between Turnford and Nazeing is Langridge Farm which is a self-pick fruit and vegetable farm.
